JobFullDesc: About the Role As a Senior Associate in the Mobility Finance team in ANZ, you will be part of the Strategic Finance team tasked with providing comprehensive financial insight into our business, while pushing to improve efficiency and growth. You will help drive financial planning, forecasting, reporting and analysis, partnering with Operations and Marketing to improve our business. You will be a key partner to regional leadership that supports our business in Australia and New Zealand.If you're ready to go deep working on a rewarding set of challenges and if you've got the finance skills, passion, and a strong team mentality - read on and get in touch! What You’ll Do:Financial planning and analysis: work closely with the finance organization and with business leaders in ANZ to develop financial forecasts and operational goals, apply business judgment and financial insights to help with decision makingBusiness partnering: you will work closely with various country and regional teams across ANZ as a key finance partner to the businessSophisticated financial modeling: build models from scratch, improve existing models, break complex models down into its most granular componentsProcess improvement: help improve our planning processes and ensure finance best practices spread through the organizationSpecial projects: new initiatives always come up, you will have the chance to contribute beyond traditional FP&A on a variety of projectsInnovation: Be creative, adaptive, and eager to learn new (technical) skillsWhat You'll Need:Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or similarFinancial planning, reporting, business partneringConsulting, investment banking, private equity, venture capital all acceptable for correct candidates4-5 years of proven experience in Corporate Finance or Operational FP&A at either a high-growth tech startup or a large, well-established company. Investment Banking, Private Equity and Management Consulting will also be considered for candidates that demonstrate relevant experienceExceptional analytical skills - Best practices are second-nature, your models are efficient, scalable, and intuitiveExcellent communication and people skills - numbers are key, but a business is built with peopleSelf-starter - You will take initiative, be dedicated, set and drive toward goalsExperience with Excel, SQL, and/or statistical software packageAttention to detail - consistent with swift execution
